cause.description:
Juvenile Neuronal Ceroid Lipofuscinoses is a degenerating disease of the brain. This is a disease of children, affecting both young boys and young girls. It is found in all races throughout the world. Children generally live to their late teens or early twenty’s. For each child disease progression is different but the cause remains the same, a mutation in the JNCL gene.
1. Children go blind, then experience seizures, dementia, difficulty sleeping, hyperactivity, loss of motor and mental capacity.
2. Develop a database of information with regards to measuring disease progression of JNCL, to gage success of clinical trials
3. Work with government agencies to encourage the funding of active research on JNCL
4. Determine the applicability of various therapeutic approaches
5. Neuronal Ceroid Lipofuscinoses Research Alliance (NCLRA) is a united group of international foundations who's purpose is to aid in the coordination of bringing potential therapies to clinical trials for the three major forms of NCL
cause.mission: Find a Cure for these Children.
cause.name: Juvenile NCL
